intro: Callichroa platyglossa, commonly known as the broad-tongued callichroa, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The leaves are ovate and often have a waxy texture, while the flowers are pollinated primarily by birds and insects.
